alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 5:33PM EDT until August 20 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey...including the following county...Morris. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 532 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Pequannock Township. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 49 and 51. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
